t: Exodus 20
The Ten Commandments
And*p God spoke all these words, saying:
“I*pn am*i the Lord*s your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
“You*ld shall have no other gods before Me.
“You*ld shall not make for yourself a carved image—any likeness of*i anything*i that is*i in heaven above, or that is*i in the earth beneath, or that is*i in the water under the earth;

you shall not bow down to them nor serve them. For I, the Lord*s your God, am*i a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generations*i of those who hate Me,
but showing mercy to thousands, to those who love Me and keep My commandments.
“You*ld shall not take the name of the Lord*s your God in vain, for the Lord*s will not hold him*i guiltless who takes His name in vain.
“Remember*ld the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
Six days you shall labor and do all your work,

but the seventh day is*i the Sabbath of the Lord*s your God. In*i it*i you shall do no work: you, nor your son, nor your daughter, nor your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your cattle, nor your stranger who is*i within your gates.
For in*i six days the Lord*s made the heavens and the earth, the sea, and all that is*i in them, and rested the seventh day. Therefore the Lord*s blessed the Sabbath day and hallowed it.
“Honor*ld your father and your mother, that your days may be long upon the land which the Lord*s your God is giving you.
“You*ld shall not murder.
“You*ld shall not commit adultery.
“You*ld shall not steal.
“You*ld shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.

“You*ld shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, nor his male servant, nor his female servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is*i your neighbor’s.”
The People Afraid of God’s Presence
Now*p all the people witnessed the thunderings, the lightning flashes, the sound of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it,*i they trembled and stood afar off.
Then they said to Moses, “You speak with us, and we will hear; but let not God speak with us, lest we die.”
And*p Moses said to the people, “Do not fear; for God has come to test you, and that His fear may be before you, so that you may not sin.”
So the people stood afar off, but Moses drew near the thick darkness where God was.*i
The Law of the Altar
Then*p the Lord*s said to Moses, “Thus you shall say to the children of Israel: ‘You have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
You shall not make anything*i to*i be*i with Me—gods of silver or gods of gold you shall not make for yourselves.

An altar of earth you shall make for Me, and you shall sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep and your oxen. In every place where I record My name I will come to you, and I will bless you.
And if you make Me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of hewn stone; for if you use your tool on it, you have profaned it.
Nor shall you go up by steps to My altar, that your nakedness may not be exposed on it.’
